DOC.detailed_description: Non communicable chronic disease arterial hypertension ( AH ) diabetes ( DM ) great burden public health Cameroon . However , outside main city access appropriate diagnosis treatment health-conditions still poor . The Swiss NGO `` Fondation Coop√©ration Afrique '' start 2007 program integrate chronic disease management focus AH DM primary health care system peripheral non-physician health facility rural area Central Cameroon . A first evaluation one year reveal low treatment adherence among newly diagnose patient main challenge . In order improve patient 's adherence expose randomly one three intervention : The first intervention consist write agreement long-lasting therapy ( treatment contract ) . Patients get information importance regular long term treatment personal engagement follow treatment clinical control regularly . The second intervention introduces addition treatment contract reminder system . In case follow-up failure community worker trace patient recall visit health centre . The third intervention consist treatment contract combine financial incentive form one month free treatment four month regular follow-up . We allocate randomly one three intervention health center .
